content.meaning: White Belt represents innocence, as of a beginning student who has no previous knowledge of Taekwondo.
content.significance: The white belt symbolizes the blank canvas of a new student, ready to absorb knowledge and begin their martial arts journey.

questions.question: What does the white belt represent?
questions.answer: Innocence, as of a beginning student who has no previous knowledge of Taekwondo.

content.overview: The five tenets of Taekwondo form the foundation of moral and ethical behavior for all practitioners.

tenets.name: Courtesy
tenets.description: Being polite and showing respect to others, including instructors, fellow students, and oneself.

tenets.name: Integrity
tenets.description: Being honest and having strong moral principles; doing what is right even when no one is watching.

tenets.name: Perseverance
tenets.description: Having the determination to continue despite difficulties or obstacles.

tenets.name: Self Control
tenets.description: The ability to control one's emotions, actions, and words, especially in challenging situations.

tenets.name: Indomitable Spirit
tenets.description: Having an unbreakable will and the courage to stand up for what is right.

questions.question: How many tenets of Taekwondo are there?
What is the Korean term for Courtesy?

content.overview: The Taekwondo Association of Great Britain (TAGB) was founded to promote traditional Taekwondo in the United Kingdom.

founding.purpose: To establish a unified system of traditional Taekwondo instruction in Great Britain

content.development: The TAGB has grown to become one of the largest Taekwondo organizations in the UK, maintaining strong ties to traditional ITF-style Taekwondo.

greeting_terms.usage: Respectful greeting used when entering or leaving the dojang
Used to show gratitude to instructors and training partners

dojang_terms.usage: The place where Taekwondo is practiced
The traditional white clothing worn during training
